reviewText: A truly unique experience. Carmageddon spiced up by the ability to smack the living ♥♥♥♥ out of your opponents while you're on foot. Great soundtrack. Charismatic Liddy, boss of the Company - the gang our protagonist joins in the beginning. Rant singing Kumbaya. Four rival gangs - each with their own flavor. And all of these set in a pretty good-looking post-apocalyptic wasteland. Maaaan, do i miss the 90s.

reviewText:
It was a great game, however it has a lot of technical issues and I can't recommend you buy it. The Steam version is the same as the one on GOG, so don't expect that one to be any different. Both are at version 1.1 (the menu will say 1.0, this has always been the case, the patch never changed that number, so ignore it, and ignore all the people in the forum thinking they have to install the patch. That does nothing.)

The game's level design is pretty bad, but otherwise it was a fun FPS that also had decent car combat (and every car had an interior camera view!). It was fun blowing up bad guys into red chunks, and the way your weapon would transform into different versions was very cool. The animation for turning your assault rifle into a buzzsaw or sniper rifle was always entertaining.

Sadly, as I said, the game has a ton of issues currently. I was able to get it running on Windows 10 (though a lot of people in the forum can't get it to run at all. I did nothing special, so I have no idea why others are having issues getting it to launch), however you cannot change the resolution any higher than 1280x1024, the framerate is capped at 30fps, there's no way to increase the extremely small FOV, and if you use one of the fanmade patches to get a higher resolution (I was able to get it to launch at 1920x1080) the game will not run through Steam. Hence why it says I've only put a handful of minutes in the game.

Among other smaller issues is that the mouse will go wonky in some menus, slowing to a stuttering crawl, making it very hard to change keybindings and graphic settings. The soundtrack is screwed up and every single level starts with the same loud song (track02, which you can find under the Bonus Content folder), which plays for about 2 minutes and then stops. It doesn't play any of the other 8 songs this game has, it doesn't loop that one song, it just.. stops.

That one song will begin playing once a cutscene starts, too, so if you haven't turned it off (it's the CD Audio" setting) then you'll have an impossible time trying to hear any of the characters.

If you don't mind playing with no music

reviewText:
⚠ DOES NOT WORK WITH WINDOWS 8.1 or 10

For Win 8.1: The game is very laggy, particularly after going to the options menu. And there's a horrid clipping glitch, where textures are all over the place and covers most of the screen. Also, about 10% of the time, the game crashes immediately after starting. I contacted Retroism, the company that owns this game, and they said running it in compatibility mode for Windows 98/Windows Me has fixed lag for SOME people, so if you're having issues, that's worth a try. It didn't help with me though, and unfortunately I'm not alone. I also tried compatibility mode for Windows XP, Vista, 7, and 8 with no luck.

For Win10: The game will not open, period. A popup comes up and it say Wheels has stopped." Windows 10 isn't optimized to play most old games though

reviewText: Redline is a unique combat driving/fps hybrid. Both the fps and the combat driving elements control great and feel good. But I strongly recommend remapping the controls. The first 9 levels (out of 12) are well designed and the combat works well. The gameplay in these levels are well paced with proper incrementing difficulty. But the last three levels of the game are very glitchy and overly difficult (which is not retroism or night dive's fault). I spent a few hours trying to finish the last three levels due to saving and door glitches, as well as the overly difficult level Area 51 (the part with the aliens). The first nine levels alone are worth playing and worth the money. I would welcome a reboot. 8/10

reviewText:
***Don't buy it at 6.99. I am reviewing the game for what it is, ignoring that gouging price tag completely. There are 99 cent games with more replayability and fun than Redline, even a skin on Dota 2 would net you more joy than this***

Redline is probably the greatest game to have come out on January 1st, 1999.

You drive cars with physics that are neck-breaking at best, but they have more variety and challenge to them than Borderlands has ever offered. The gunplay is absolutely terrible, with one-gun-fitting-all and very little use for the sniper rifle... Or machine gun, or grenades, or the saw-thing, but ya kinda end up using all of them at one point or another. It's a little hard, even for a seasoned FPS veteran, and I'd stay away if you weren't playing for the nostalgia value, but

at the end of the day, it's something to play on a rainy day, and it's a small challenge. I probably won't ever even end up finishing it, it's got 20 missions too many, is terribly linear, but if you want to see what good car firefights are, go no further than this game.
